Mulberry Spring Farm

A historical vacation destination
nestled in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains.

The Cottage
At Mulberry Spring

This charming two story cottage is set on rolling land overlooking dry stacked stone walls and forest. The first floor is an open floor plan with a stone fireplace at one end opposite the kitchen. A single bedroom upstairs hosts a over-sized full mattress. Full bath downstairs.

See More

The Cabin
At Mulberry Spring

A humble, rustic two story cottage on rolling land overlooking dry stacked stone walls and forest. The cabin hosts a cozy living room with a wood stove, an equipped kitchen, and full bath. A bedroom with a queen bed is upstairs, .

See More

Monroe House
at Mulberry Springs

The Monroe House at Mulberry Springs is a historic two-story Colonial residence (c. 1750's) situated in a picturesque complex of barns, guest cottages, and outbuildings on 15.4 rolling acres. The perfect getaway for a family or pair of couples.

See More

Bingham Mountain Cottage

Bingham Mountain Cottage is a rustic barn that has been recently converted into a studio apartment. Located two miles from Mulberry Spring Farm, the cottage is perched at the foothills of Bingham Mountain, and has incredible views of the rolling farmland that surrounds. A very unique spot.

See More

About Us

Mulberry Springs Farm is a historic Virginia property dating back to the 1750s. It has been completely renovated and is now open to the airbnb community! Mulberry Springs is owned and operated by Leonne and Ilija from Gloucester County, Va. Their son's years attending the University of Virginia prompted frequent trips to Charlottesville. They have since fallen in love with the foot hills of the Blue Ridge Mountains and hope to share the experience with others.

Contact

For inquiries into events, group discounts, or long term stays, please call or email us.
